Referencia: MTM2015-69068-REDT. 
Periode: Gener 2016 - Desembre 2017.




Our group interacts in different ways with other research groups. While we are not a “Consolidated Research Group” of the Generalitat de Catalunya, we have traditionally been part of two of them (only one researcher per SGR as required).

Some of our members belong to GRBio, Grup de Recerca en Bioestadística i Bioinformàtica, a consolidated research group of the Generalitat de Catalunya, with whom we share orientations and research interests.
Others are members of the Biomarkers in Nutrition and Metabolomic Research Group with whom we work together in a variety of projects in the interface between metabolomics, and nutrition.

Besides this, we have a kind relation with the Statistics and Bioinformatics Unit (UEB) in Vall d’Hebron Research Institute (VHIR), which we contributed to create and which was led by Alex Sanchez for more than 12 years (2008-2020).

title: Research
text:
Our group interacts in different ways with other research groups. While we are not a “Consolidated Research Group” of the Generalitat de Catalunya, we have traditionally been part of two of them (only one researcher per SGR as required).

Some of our members belong to GRBio, Grup de Recerca en Bioestadística i Bioinformàtica, a consolidated research group of the Generalitat de Catalunya, with whom we share orientations and research interests.
Others are members of the Biomarkers in Nutrition and Metabolomic Research Group with whom we work together in a variety of projects in the interface between metabolomics, and nutrition.

Besides this, we have a kind relation with the Statistics and Bioinformatics Unit (UEB) in Vall d’Hebron Research Institute (VHIR), which we contributed to create and which was led by Alex Sanchez for more than 12 years (2008-2020).

title: About us
text:
About us
Our group was born in the former Statistics Department of the Faculty of Biology, that has now evolved into the Genetics, Microbiology and Statistics department.
Our strong interdisciplinary vocation has lead us to collaborate and become integrated withother research groups. While we are not a “Consolidated Research Group” of the Generalitat de Catalunya, we intersect with two f them work with two of them.
Some of our members belong to GRBio, Grup de Recerca en Bioestadística i Bioinformàtica, a consolidated research group of the Generalitat de Catalunya, with whom we share orientations and research interests.
Others are members of the Biomarkers in Nutrition and Metabolomic Research Group with whom we work together in a variety of projects in the interface between metabolomics, and nutrition.
Besides this, we have a kind relation with the Statistics and Bioinformatics Unit (UEB) in Vall d’Hebron Research Institute (VHIR), which we contributed to create and which was led by Alex Sanchez for more than 12 years (2008-2020).

title: Statistics and Bioinformatics Research Group
text:
Bioinformatics, the multidisciplinary science that deals with the acquisition, processing and analysis of biological information, through the application of techniques and tools from computer science, mathematics or biology, has been decisive in the development of life orr health sciences during the last decades. Statistics has contributed to these developments, particularly by providing methods of data analysis. At the same time, however, it has benefited from it, facing problems that have fueled its growth in several areas.
The Statistics and Bioinformatics Research Group (EstBioinfo) has as its main objective the research, development and application of statistical methods in problems that arise at the interface between bioinformatics and statistics.
Our interest has evolved from omics data analysis to methods and tools for the integrative analysis of multi-omics data and their applications in diverse fields ranging from oncology and neurology to nutrition and metabolomics
Our group research lines includes

Integrative analysis of omics data using biological knolwedge
Machine learning and AI for omics data integration and interpretation
Bioinformatics Software development
Applications in Nutrition and Metabolomics

title: Software
text:
As part of our research we develop distinct type of applications, most of them using R. These can be accessed through our personal github sites and also as public shiny applications that we provide through the GrBio web server
